Data: Anderson to Smith, no run lets the ball zip through outside off
Anderson to Smith, no run good line and length from Anderson, Smith nods it through to the keeper
Anderson to Smith, no run gets on the front foot and punches into the off side
Anderson to Smith, no run working up a sweat, again Smith ignores the ball outside off
Anderson to Smith, no run pushed through the channel, no stroke
Anderson to Smith, no run back of a length and closer to the stumps, Smith defends down on to the track - maiden for Anderson, who is the first bowler to get his economy below three
Bresnan to Haddin, no run length delivery in the channel outside off, dabbed towards point playing back
Bresnan to Haddin, no run angled in, short of a length and worked towards midwicket from the crease
Bresnan to Haddin, SIX runs pitched up on off stump, belted back down the ground by Haddin, nonchalant swing of the arms and it goes into the stands
Bresnan to Haddin, no run stays back and defends in front of the stumps

Bresnan to Haddin, 2 runs hits on the up again, this is much more aerial and lands short of the rope at long-on, sticking in the turf - that brace brings up Haddin's half-century, he's passed 50 for the fourth time in the series
Bresnan to Haddin, no run touch short and wide, cut off the back foot but well stopped at backward point
Broad to Smith, no run good length outside the line of off, defends into the off side
Broad to Smith, no run gets on the front foot and again meets a good-length ball with a prod into the covers
Broad to Smith, no run defended coming forwards once more
Broad to Smith, FOUR runs full and wide and laced through the covers, steps out to meet what was basically a half-volley and carve another boundary
Broad to Smith, no run full again, driven into the off side and fielded on the bounce at mid-off
Broad to Smith, no run pitched up on the stumps, comes forward and pushes to mid-on this time
Bresnan to Haddin, no run length ball, comes forward and pushes into the covers

Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run bit of width, Haddin throws his hands at it and top-edges over cover, it's in the air for plenty time but Carberry, on the boundary, doesn't spot it in time and can't get there before the bounce... More frustration for England
Bresnan to Smith, no run line and length ball shaping back from outside off, Smith shoulders arms
Bresnan to Smith, no run length ball, outside off, defended
Bresnan to Smith, no run gets across his stumps and again offers no stroke
Bresnan to Smith, no run slightly full outside the line of off stump, defended with a straight bat
Broad to Haddin, 1 run short and rising towards the ribcage, flicked through backward square for a single
Broad to Smith, no run gets forward and leaves one alone in the channel
Broad to Smith, no run drags his length down, the ball goes through at chest height outside off
Broad to Smith, no run slightly back of a length, hints at coming back but was wide enough in the first place for Smith to leave
Broad to Smith, no run drops in another bouncer, Smith sways his way below the line
Broad to Smith, no run Broad plugs away in the corridor outside off but Smith isn't all that keen on playing those
Bresnan to Haddin, no run full of a length and around off stump, Haddin pushes it back down the track
Bresnan to Haddin, no run comes forward and meets the ball on the up into the off side
Bresnan to Haddin, no run slings this down very wide of the wicket, Haddin watches it pass by
Bresnan to Haddin, no run touch full and well outside off, driven off the front foot but can't get the ball past mid-off
Bresnan to Haddin, no run full and wide and again Haddin lets it through
Bresnan to Haddin, no run length ball, top of off stump, Haddin gets in behind it to defend
Broad to Smith, no run full and outside off, sticking to their plan now, Smith defends
Broad to Smith, FOUR runs *tears up plan* too short and wide and Smith rocks back to thrash four through backward point
Broad to Smith, no run gets on to the front foot to block towards extra cover
Broad to Smith, no run shorter, around off stump, carefully defended on the back foot
Broad to Smith, no run bangs this in short and Smith levers himself out of the way
Broad to Smith, no run Broad maintaining a good pace, Smith prods a short ball into the leg side
Bresnan to Haddin, no run in the channel outside off, left alone
Bresnan to Haddin, no run shortens his length, comes across and defends into the off side
Bresnan to Haddin, no run on the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
Bresnan to Haddin, no run gets in line and defends diligently into the covers
Bresnan to Haddin, no run pseudo bouncer from Bresna, wobbling through as Haddin studiously takes evasive action
Bresnan to Haddin, no run tight line, comes forward to block again
Stokes to Smith, no run full and on off stump, punched towards mid-on, Smith half closing the bat face
Stokes to Smith, 1 run works a single behind square on the leg side
Stokes to Haddin, 1 run touch short and wide of the stumps, drops back and steers towards point
Stokes to Smith, no run good pace and carry in the channel outside off, no stroke
Stokes to Smith, no run the first sketchy shot we've seen from Smith in a while, flinging the bat at a delivery that kicks off the turf and soars narrowly past the outside edge. Good bowling
Stokes to Smith, no run fuller, around off stump, jabbed on the up towards mid-off
Bresnan to Haddin, no run fullish, wide of the stumps, driven to the man at extra cover
Bresnan to Haddin, 1 run length outside off, goes back and opens the face, takes one to third man
Bresnan to Smith, no run tight lines from Bresnan, the batsman tapping the ball back down the pitch
Bresnan to Smith, no run Smith gets across and stays upright to chop a length ball short on the off side
Bresnan to Smith, no run line and length in the corridor from Bresnan, another leave
Bresnan to Smith, no run length outside off, no stroke - ladies and gentlemen, we have a Test match
Stokes to Haddin, no run length just outside off stump, defended going back and across
Stokes to Haddin, no run shorter and straighter, Haddin up on his toes and dropping this into midwicket
Stokes to Haddin, no run fuller and wide enough to leave alone
Stokes to Haddin, no run back of a length a foot outside off, Haddin fiddles it into the gully playing slightly away from his body, guides it down

Stokes to Haddin, OUT short and pulled and misues it to midwicket and England have a long-awaited breakthrough, mighty relief for them, they check the no-ball and once again Stokes is ever-so-close to the Popping crease but he's got a minuscule of a boot behind the line. It was banged in by Stokes, Haddin was hurried into pulling and spooned it to Anderson who got down to take the catch sliding forward
Stokes to Johnson, 1 run length ball at the body, tucked down to long leg
Bresnan to Johnson, no run full length just outside off, pushed firmly into the covers
Bresnan to Johnson, no run bumper and Johnson is well under it
Bresnan to Johnson, no run full and wide, Johnson chases it and swings and misses, slightly ill-advised stroke
Bresnan to Johnson, no run tighter line, better length, Johnson forward to push firmly up towards mid-off
Bresnan to Johnson, FOUR runs hint of width and a touch short, Johnson up on his toes to slap it through extra cover, wasn't quite there for the cut but Johnson has forced it away very nicely
Bresnan to Johnson, no run bumper and Johnson ducks again
Stokes to Smith, no run good length just outside off, Smith forward pressing into the covers
Stokes to Smith, 1 run short ball, hooked in control out to deep square leg
Stokes to Johnson, 1 wide bumper but this is too short and called wide
Stokes to Johnson, no run back of a length at the body, Johnson gets up and tucks it into midwicket
Stokes to Johnson, 1 leg bye off the thigh pad down leg side, Prior scrambled across and saves more than one
Stokes to Smith, no run full just outside off, smoothly driven to mid-off
Stokes to Smith, 1 run short, pulled nicely out to deep square leg
Anderson to Smith, no run full just outside off, driven to cover point
Anderson to Smith, no run length delivery two feet wide of off stump, left alone
Anderson to Smith, no run firm driven from a foot outside off, full length again, finds mid-off
Anderson to Smith, 1 run drops his length slightly, straighter line too and tucked through midwicket
Anderson to Johnson, no run full at the pads, tucked straight to square leg
Anderson to Johnson, no run similar line, slightly shorter, tried to work it down to long leg but found square leg again
Stokes to Smith, no run good length on off stump, Smith across to block
Stokes to Smith, no run straight line and fuller, Smith forward and pushes down to mid-on
Stokes to Smith, 2 runs fuller again, whipped off the pads out to deep square leg, wide of the fielder so they get two
Stokes to Smith, 1 run shorter length and pulled easily out to deep square leg
Stokes to Johnson, no run full on off stump, Johnson tries to whip to leg and finds midwicket
Stokes to Johnson, 1 run short ball, pulled in controlled fashion out to deep square
Swann to Johnson, no run forward press on the stumps and pops it back up not too far away from Swann's left hand, far enough
Swann to Johnson, 3 runs another firm forward push and squirts this off a thick outside edge down towards third man, chase for Carberry and he does well, quick outfield here
Swann to Smith, 1 run touch short and moved with the angle around the corner for an easy single
Swann to Johnson, no run around the wicket, off stump line, Johnson blocks from the crease
Swann to Johnson, no run floated up and driven firmly to cover
Swann to Johnson, no run longer lean outside off blocking into the off side

Stokes to Smith, no run full length just outside off, Smith leans forward and gets a healthy edge but remarkably it falls short of Cook diving forward at first slip, would not think edges wouldn't be carrying on this deck
Stokes to Smith, no run left alone outside off stump
Stokes to Smith, no run similar area and ignored again
Stokes to Smith, FOUR runs fuller and straighter and Smith plays a lovely straight drive, beautiful timing, full swing of the bat through the line
Stokes to Smith, no run step forward across the off stump and blocks

Stokes to Smith, FOUR runs short and pulled in front of square. Smith has a hundred! What an innings, at just the perfect time right when he side needed him and he's played superbly and his best stroke of the day, the pull, takes him to the milestone, his second Test ton
Swann to Johnson, no run blocked on the stumps from the crease
Swann to Johnson, FOUR runs touch short and cut hard, beats Carberry diving at point and finds the fence
Swann to Johnson, no run forward blocking on off stump into the covers
Swann to Johnson, no run hangs back and tries to late cut a ball far too full for the stroke, plays and misses
Swann to Johnson, no run forward on off stump, more solid defence
Swann to Johnson, 1 run full on the stumps and ran down to long-off
Root to Johnson, no run around the wicket on the stumps, Johnson forward blocking to leg
Root to Johnson, no run overpitched, met on the full actually and slapped back to the bowler
Root to Johnson, FOUR runs tossed up and leathered back over Root's head for a one-bounce four, brings the 300 up, big strike, very sweet
Root to Johnson, no run forward just blocking now
Root to Johnson, no run covers up again in front of off stump
Root to Johnson, no run forward again and tapped into the covers
Swann to Smith, no run forward on off stump, running this back to the bowler
Swann to Smith, 1 run touch short and easily flicked with the spin through square leg
Swann to Johnson, no run forward on middle and ran back to the bowler
Swann to Johnson, no run more flight from around the wicket, forward blocking again
Swann to Johnson, no run floated up on the stumps and pushed gently into the covers
Swann to Johnson, 1 run touch straight and worked down to long-on
Broad to Johnson, no run forced off the back foot from off stump with the angle to point
Broad to Johnson, no run off stump again, a touch fuller, flicked to midwicket
Broad to Johnson, 1 run too straight and pulled down to long leg
Broad to Smith, no run full on off stump, Smith keeps it out on the crease
Broad to Smith, no run same length but a foot wide of off stump so Smith leaves alone
Broad to Smith, no run good line from Broad, Smith a touch unsure in defending on the crease around off stump
Anderson to Johnson, 1 run full and a little inswing which Johnson uses to turn off the stumps into midwicket for a quick single
Anderson to Smith, 2 runs just back in length, Smith angles it down and runs it away towards third man, chase back for Swann
Anderson to Smith, no run full down the leg side, ignored
Anderson to Smith, no run straighter line, blocked from the crease up the wicket
Anderson to Smith, no run wide enough to leave alone outside off
Anderson to Smith, no run wide enough yet again to leave alone
Broad to Johnson, no run angled across Johnson who leaves alone
Broad to Johnson, FOUR runs full just outside off, Johnson drives at it and gets a thick outside edge through gully
Broad to Johnson, 1 run short outside off, fetched on the pull into the leg side, got it down early and takes a single to deep square
Broad to Smith, no run back of a length outside off, Smith pushes it in front of point but the fielder is up quickly to save the single
Broad to Smith, no run full and well wide of off, Smith leant forward but left alone
Broad to Smith, no run tighter line, forward and runs it to point
Anderson to Johnson, no run back of a length just outside off, Johnson from the crease pushes into the covers
Anderson to Johnson, no run tighter line, pushed straight this time and Pietersen comes across from mid-off to save with a dive
Anderson to Johnson, no run nicely bowled, full and draws Anderson out to play, beats the outside edge
Anderson to Johnson, no run firmly defended in the crease up the wicket around off stump
Anderson to Johnson, 1 run straighter line, tucked out through square leg
Anderson to Smith, no run nice again from Anderson, draws the batsman forward and beats his outside edge with a bit of wobble
Broad to Johnson, no run short ball, pulled hard and misses
Broad to Johnson, FOUR runs short outside off, pulled hard in front of square and finds the midwicket fence, fifty stand up
Broad to Johnson, FOUR runs steps to leg and smashes a back of a length ball over mid-off, had to reach out for it because he'd backed away so much but nailed it
Broad to Johnson, no run pulled again, this time not timed and it's on the bounce to midwicket where Root fields
Broad to Johnson, 1 run another short ball, another pull and Johnson finds deep-square leg safely
Broad to Smith, no run back foot push straight to cover
Anderson to Johnson, no run forward to a length ball around off, blocked back to the bowler
Anderson to Johnson, no run looked to turn it to leg but got squared up a little and it comes off high on the bat and squirts towards point
Anderson to Johnson, 1 run length ball on the stumps, worked through midwicket from the crease
Anderson to Smith, no run full length at the off stump, Smith drives to mid-off
Anderson to Smith, no run length ball two feet wide of off, left alone
Anderson to Smith, no run tighter line but left again covering the off stump
Bresnan to Johnson, no run forward just outside off to block to cover
Bresnan to Johnson, no run played from the crease just outside off and dabbed down in front of point
Bresnan to Johnson, no run blocked again covering the off stump
Bresnan to Johnson, no run straight line, looks to turn it away to leg and gets hit on the pad
Bresnan to Johnson, no run straight line again, Johnson flicks away to midwicket
Bresnan to Johnson, 2 runs fuller length and flicked past midwicket for a couple
Anderson to Smith, no run good length, tailing in around off stump, Smith prods the ball back on the on side
Anderson to Smith, no run length in the channel, this boings off the surface as Smith leaves, with Prior catching the ball in front of his face
Anderson to Smith, no run angled in towards the stumps, gets across to block
Anderson to Smith, no run pace and carry in the corridor outside off as Smith raises his bat high into the air
Anderson to Smith, no run steady start from Anderson, disciplined outside the line of off, left alone again
Anderson to Smith, no run length ball, nibbling back a touch as Smith pushes forward, gets an inside edge towards square leg
Broad to Johnson, no run length ball on the stumps and Johnson plays it with a straight bat in defence

Broad to Johnson, OUT super ball, bounce and movement and Prior snaffles the edge - Johnson vanquished first up! That's the perfect start for England, no runs added and the dangerous Johnson back in the hutch. They said the pitch would be quicker today and we might just seen evidence of that, a length ball fizzing off the pitch from middle and leg to brush the shoulder of the bat... Though Mitch might not mind seeing that, either
Broad to Siddle, no run good-length ball in the channel, wide enough that Siddle can take a stride and leave
Broad to Siddle, no run Broad is working up his pace, this touching 89mph/143kph, Siddle gets across to defend
Broad to Siddle, no run shoulders arms to another length delivery outside off
Broad to Siddle, no run on a length, outside the line, Siddle comes forward and pushes in front of square
Anderson to Smith, 2 runs slightly full and Smith gets on the front foot to drive a couple through the covers
Anderson to Smith, no run beaten this time, back of a length and Smith chops at it loosely with an angled bat, fails to connect
Anderson to Smith, no run probing away on a good length outside off stump, lets this one through
Anderson to Smith, no run another leave outside off
Anderson to Smith, no run cat and mouse so far, Anderson trying to draw Smith out, the batsman happy to practice putting his hands in the air (like he just don't care)
Anderson to Smith, FOUR runs enticed into a stroke this time, pushing away from his body but the edge travels low, wide of second slip and will run away to the rope - first boundary of the morning
Broad to Siddle, no run comes forward and defends a length ball into the covers
Broad to Siddle, no run touch short, outside the line of off stump, Siddle elects not to play at it
Broad to Siddle, no run plants the front foot and raises the bat out of the way
Broad to Siddle, no run dug in, this rises sharply and well over the ducking Siddle
Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs gets away with this, slicing a slightly airy push off the back foot between third slip and gully - that will be four for Sids
Broad to Siddle, no run shortish outside off, lets this one go
Anderson to Smith, no run length delivery, shapes back in towards off stump, well-judged leave from Smith
Anderson to Smith, no run tight lines from Anderson so far, this time the batsman leans on a forward defensive
Anderson to Smith, 2 runs gets on the front foot, hitting through the line and that's nicely placed, picking a gap between mid-off and cover for two
Anderson to Smith, no run Smith is driving again, looks to have settled, though this stroke results in a big inside edge on to pad

Anderson to Smith, OUT this cuts through Smith as he props forward, there's a thin sound, Anderson goes up immediately... Umpire Marais Erasmus isn't convinced but England ask to review straight away. Smith stood his ground, unruffled, but we're going to find out what technology thinks
Anderson to Harris, 1 run pitched up, angled in towards middle and off, Harris fiddles a single through square leg to get off the mark first ball
Broad to Harris, FOUR runs back of a length, this rears and takes the edge but it flies wide of the diving Root at third slip and all the way to the boundary

Broad to Harris, no run straighter line, at the batsman who tries to play across the line, the ball loops towards gully and Bell stoops low to take the catch... England are jubilant but Bowden, this time, is unmoved, so it's review time again. The ball deflected a long way, looked like possibly a leading edge at first sight but replays prove it was just Harris' meaty thighs and no bat involved
Broad to Harris, 3 runs too full and straight and neatly pushed through straight mid-on for more runs to the Rhino
Broad to Siddle, no run Siddle shuffles across and shoulders arms outside off
Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs another low edge skitters between the slips and gully, Broad does the teapot in frustration but Siddle kept that down well - 350 up for Straya
Broad to Siddle, no run goes back and across and defends around off
Anderson to Harris, no run slightly full from Anderson, hit on the up and that's well stopped by the diving Bairstow at mid-off, straight into the action and he prevents a boundary
Anderson to Harris, no run a little straight, Harris tries to whip off his pads, only picks out midwicket
Anderson to Harris, no run gets across outside off stump and plays a shortish ball into the ground towards point
Anderson to Harris, no run dug in, a bouncer that rises outside the line of off, Harris swats angrily across the line and misses
Anderson to Harris, no run comes forward and punches the ball to mid-off again
Anderson to Harris, 1 run length ball, in the channel, Harris opens the face and steers one down to third man, past the cordon but along the ground the whole way
Broad to Harris, no run length delivery, tailing back from outside off, Harris plays with an angled bat into the off side
Broad to Harris, no run pushes forward at a good-length ball and gets an inside edge, rolls between his legs but wide of the stumps
Broad to Harris, no run fired in towards the top of off stump, defended
Broad to Harris, 1 run length, Harris attacks and it takes a thick chunk of bat, skims low past backward point and down to third man
Broad to Siddle, no run comes forward to defend a length ball into the off side
Broad to Siddle, no run slightly wide, Siddle happy to let this one through
Anderson to Harris, 2 runs another neat stroke from Harris, positive cricket, he gets on the front foot and threads a couple through the covers
Anderson to Harris, no run length ball, angled back in towards off stump, shows it a straight bat in defence
Anderson to Harris, no run Anderson is touching 87-88mph (140+), tight line and defended in front of the stumps
Anderson to Harris, no run short, sliding towards the leg side, Harris swings hard but misses

Anderson to Harris, OUT pushes at a length ball in the channel and this one goes to hand, caught in the gully! Harris is cut down before he can do too much damage, another wicket for Anderson and England are close to rounding up the innings
Anderson to Lyon, no run continues to seek out a good length outside off, Lyon pokes and edges low to second slip on the bounce
Broad to Siddle, no run gets across his stumps and defends with an open face towards point

Broad to Siddle, FOUR runs Broad can't resist some chin music, though this is more of a powder-puff bouncer and with no fine leg, Siddle is comfortable in hoicking the ball aerially behind square for a boundary
Broad to Siddle, no run better length, wide of the stumps and left alone
Broad to Siddle, no run pitched up in the corridor, beginning to drift away from the batsman, who tucks his bat inside
Broad to Siddle, 2 runs on the stumps, Siddle hits on the up and scoops the ball back over Broad's head, not out of the middle but they get a couple
Broad to Siddle, no run dug in short and Siddle elects to leave this one be
Anderson to Lyon, FOUR runs outside off, not overpitched but Lyon is confident to hit through the line, places the ball straight of mid-off and that will run away - top shot from a No. 11
Anderson to Lyon, no run comes forward again and picks out mid-off with a drive this time
Anderson to Lyon, no run short and outside the line of off, Lyon ducks out of the way
Anderson to Lyon, no run on a good length, wide of the stumps, Lyon watches the ball through
Anderson to Lyon, no run extra bounce, takes the shoulder of the bat but it drops short of Joe Root at third slip, diving to his left - one hand, one bounce, maybe?
Anderson to Lyon, no run bumper, at the top of Lyon's block, he takes refuge in a crouch
Stokes to Siddle, no run fullish and there's a smidgen of away swing for Stokes, the ball darting past the outside edge
Stokes to Siddle, no run around off stump, gets in line to defend towards cover
Stokes to Siddle, no run back and across, blocked
Stokes to Siddle, no run pushed through in the channel outside off stump, this time Siddle lets it through
Stokes to Siddle, 1 run pitched up and Siddle it tempted into a loose drive, the edge flies low through that non-existent fourth slip area, though I don't think it would have carried
Stokes to Lyon, 1 run back of a length, on the hips and worked down to fine leg for a single
Bresnan to Lyon, no run length outside off, defended coming forwards
Bresnan to Lyon, no run in the channel, wide of the stumps, Lyon lets it through
Bresnan to Lyon, no run angled in towards the top of off stump from wide on the crease, Lyon gets in line to defend
Bresnan to Lyon, no run straightens his line even further, strikes the thigh pad as Lyon plays across the line
Bresnan to Lyon, FOUR runs pitched up and on-driven for four, sweetly struck by Lyon, made a little room for himself and dismissed the ball back down the ground
Bresnan to Lyon, no run well-directed bumper, at the man, who takes evasive action
Stokes to Siddle, 1 run short of a length, Siddle closes the face and nudges one off his body into a gap at midwicket
Stokes to Lyon, no run steepling bouncer from Stokes, again Lyon ducks
Stokes to Lyon, FOUR runs fullish, just holding its line outside off, squirts low off the outside edge, between third slip and gully once again and away for another boundary
Stokes to Lyon, no run this comes back at Lyon, who plays an extravagant drive, gets an inside edge on to his back pad
Stokes to Lyon, FOUR runs hit on the up again and like a bullet, comes off the bat with a crack and flies through the covers - four more, sir
Stokes to Lyon, no run length ball, pokes at this one and it bounces towards cover
Bresnan to Siddle, 2 runs pitched up outside off and Siddle just leans on a push through the covers for two more to the total
Bresnan to Siddle, 2 runs straighter line, Siddle heaves across the line and gets an inside edge through square leg for a couple
Bresnan to Siddle, no run off stump, on a length, defended with an open face towards point
Bresnan to Siddle, 1 run slightly back of a length, over the stumps, tucked short of midwicket for a single this time
Bresnan to Lyon, no run bouncer and it doesn't get up as much as Lyon expects, he takes it right on the side of the helmet - ow
Bresnan to Lyon, no run short again, testing those reflexes, not to mention the chutzpah, Lyon gets his noggin out of the way this time
Stokes to Siddle, no run back of a length and coming back in towards the batsman, who defends from the crease
Stokes to Siddle, 1 leg bye sliding down the leg side, Siddles flicks and misses but a leg bye rolls short in front of square
Stokes to Lyon, no run short and too wide for Lyon to play at
Stokes to Lyon, no run more short shrift for Lyon, who gets out of the way comfortably enough
Stokes to Lyon, no run extra bounce and this zips past the outside edge, Lyon just managing to get his bat inside the line as he hung back in the crease
Stokes to Lyon, no run dug in short again, Lyon sways back and attempts an uppercut over the slips, fails to connect
Bresnan to Siddle, no run short of a good length, wide of the stumps and Siddle offers no stroke
Bresnan to Siddle, no run gets on the front foot to defend into the covers

Bresnan to Siddle, OUT holding its line outside off, Siddle dangles the bat and there's a tickle on it, an audible nick and visible deflection through to the keeper. Bresnan gets his first wicket, ending a sticky little 31-run association between Siddle and Lyon

11.57am: Now the real work starts for England. Having been held up for 40 minutes by the last pair, they will consider that another unsatisfactory passage; but the ease with which even Lyon managed to stroke a few handy runs should encourage England's batsmen too. They'll get half an hour before lunch, on a quick, flat pitch with a lightning outfield. This is England's series right now and Alastair Cook needs a few brave bulging buoyant clairvoyants centurions to step up from within the ranks. I'll be back
Back to pace at both ends, Watto on for Lyon
Watson to Root, no run Root is caught with his bat hung flagrantly outside off, there was a hint of away swing for Watson and it beats the edge
Watson to Root, no run straighter line this time, holding around off and blocked
Watson to Root, no run comes forward and pushes the ball along the ground towards mid-ff
Watson to Root, no run full and wide, swinging further away from the batsman, who ignores it

Watson to Root, OUT beats the bat again, a subtle curve away from Root as he plays forward ... Australia go up in unison and after a moment's thought, Erasmus gives it. Root, however, goes straight to the DRS, he seems certain he didn't hit it. We're getting numerous replays, can't see a mark on Hot Spot, no visible deviation. Real-Time Snicko doesn't prove anything either, though there is a sound, apparently after the ball had passed the bat. Tony Hill appears to be telling Erasmus he can't be cert
Watson to Pietersen, no run on the stumps, Pietersen gets solidly behind it in defence
Johnson to Cook, no run left alone in the channel outside off
Johnson to Cook, no run gets across his stumps and plays the ball towards mid-on
Johnson to Cook, no run length ball, quite wide and again Cook is happy to watch it through
Johnson to Cook, 1 run there's another surge around the ground as Cook takes on the short ball, there are catchers in the deep but he keeps this down and gets one to deep square leg
Johnson to Pietersen, no run Johnson fires the ball in full on off stump, Pietersen was back in his crease but sees the ball well and blocks
Johnson to Pietersen, no run dug in short and Pietersen hops back, stays on top of the bounce and blocks to leg
Watson to Cook, no run Cook stays back and defends on leg stump
Watson to Cook, no run pushed across Cook, full and wide in the corridor, left alone
Watson to Cook, no run Watson pitches on middle and off, doesn't seem to be swinging on this line, Cook taps to midwicket
Watson to Cook, no run floated up in the channel, another juicy tempter, left alone
Watson to Cook, no run fractionally full of a good length, shaping on off stump, Cook plays late and blocks into the off side
Watson to Cook, no run a ripper from Watto, this one pitches on middle and then zangs away towards first slip, past Cook's groping bat. Squeaky
Johnson to Pietersen, no run this is quick from MJ, up above 93mph/150ph, forcing KP to jerkily defend on the back foot
Johnson to Pietersen, no run feisty bumper, sails over Pietersen's head
Johnson to Pietersen, no run short and not-so-sweet again, too high to trouble anyone but the keeper, though
Johnson to Pietersen, no run length on the stumps, Pietersen plays the ball firmly into the off side
Johnson to Pietersen, no run Johnson slides this across Pietersen, full and towards the slips, drives with the bat well away from the body, inside-edge on to pad
Johnson to Pietersen, no run fired across on a length, plays back and steers the ball towards backward point - KP survives to reach tea, with both teams now getting their teeth into this match
Siddle to Cook, no run full at the pads, carefully tucked to square leg
Siddle to Cook, no run full at the pads again, Cook forward tucking to leg again and times it well but straight to midwicket, hint of inswing there
Siddle to Cook, no run slid across Cook who leaves alone
Siddle to Cook, no run tucked to midwicket again, this time from the crease to a ball a touch shorter than a good length
Siddle to Cook, 2 runs Cook away now, punching off the back foot through cover, hint of width offered
Siddle to Cook, no run full length a foot wide of off stump, left alone
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full and wide enough to leave alone outside off stump
Johnson to Pietersen, no run length down leg side, Pietersen flicks at it and misses
Johnson to Pietersen, no run forward on the stumps, pressing up towards mid-off
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full and wide and easily ignored
Johnson to Pietersen, no run back of a length around the off stump, Pietersen up on his toes and dabbing towards point
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run fuller and dropped into the covers, Pietersen is off for a single and gets off the mark at the 15th attempt, sharp single and they get home easily
Siddle to Pietersen, 1 run a second sharp single to cover from a forward press
Siddle to Cook, no run full length at the stumps, Cook a touch unsure in coming forward and stuck on the pad, it was going down
Siddle to Cook, no run full down leg and ignored
Siddle to Cook, no run right up there again, forward to block around middle
Siddle to Cook, no run full once more, a foot wide of off stump and left alone
Siddle to Cook, no run full and some inswing to off stump, Cook a little hurried in coming forward to drive and gets a thick outside edge to point
Johnson to Pietersen, no run sharp bumper, 90mph, Pietersen manages to get out of the way to let it pass over his leg stump, Haddin takes a blinder with one hand reaching up with the right mitt
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full on the stumps, Pietersen is often susceptible to that, shapes in a touch too, Pietersen rolls it back up the wicket
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 run another full straight delivery, Pietersen nudges it back up the wicket and Johnson misses the fielding so they get a single between mid-off and mid-on
Johnson to Cook, 1 run full, angled into the pads, Cook gives it a tickle to long leg
Johnson to Pietersen, no run bumper, well directed, Pietersen ducks
Johnson to Pietersen, no run at the ribs this time, Pietersen up on his toes and knocking it down towards leg stump
Siddle to Cook, 5 wide huge bumper, right over the keeper's head, from Siddle? Apparently so. Brings the 100 up
Siddle to Cook, no run follows up with a goodun, beating the outside edge as Cook leant across playing forward
Siddle to Cook, no run beat him again outside off, tight enough line to force Cook into playing at it
Siddle to Cook, no run brings the line in a touch further, Cook forward to block solidly this time
Siddle to Cook, no run drops the length back slightly and Cook able to sit back and push into the covers
Siddle to Cook, no run good length on off stump, Cook tries to play from the crease and nudges it back up towards Siddle
Siddle to Cook, no run touch shorter again and Cook is struck on the hip playing from the crease, just a hint of inswing again
Harris to Pietersen, no run length delivery nibbles away from Pietersen who is forward and following one outside off, gets beaten, doesn't carry through to Haddin
Harris to Pietersen, no run plays at this again and guides it down into the gully, touch shorter length, just outside off
Harris to Pietersen, no run fuller and wider, left alone
Harris to Pietersen, no run full again, tighter line but still wide enough to ignore
Harris to Pietersen, no run wider line and easily ignored again, Harris is frustrated with himself
Harris to Pietersen, no run much straighter and Pietersen is forward and tucking up to mid-on
Siddle to Cook, no run full and nearly had Cook falling across the off stump, he gets the bat down in time
Siddle to Cook, no run fuller again on off stump, forward and tucked to midwicket
Siddle to Cook, 2 runs straighter line and Cook able to flick down to long leg, wide enough of the fielder for a couple in fact
Siddle to Cook, no run full outside off, driven without timing, rather missed out, got a thick inside edge up the wicket and mid-off is able to save the single
Siddle to Cook, FOUR runs hint of width outside off and the length is such that Cook can sit back and flick away backward of square to take him to fifty
Siddle to Cook, no run Siddle back in the groove but that is a well-judged leave from Cook outside off
Harris to Pietersen, no run full on the stumps, Pietersen forward blocking back up towards the bowler
Harris to Pietersen, no run full on off stump, driven back up towards the bowler who gets down with a creak of the back to save
Harris to Pietersen, no run full and in the slot to drive outside off, Pietersen flashes the blade at it but only finds mid-off
Harris to Pietersen, no run better length on off stump, blocked coming forward
Harris to Pietersen, no run forward again just outside off and driven back to the bowler without timing
Harris to Pietersen, no run nicely bowled, this hint of movement is keeping the bowler's very interested, a drive and a miss at this as it nibbles away
Watson to Cook, 1 run starts a touch straight and gets flicked down to long leg
Watson to Pietersen, no run forward blocking in front of off stump
Watson to Pietersen, no run forward again, carefully blocking into the point region
Watson to Pietersen, no run full and wide of off stump, left alone
Watson to Pietersen, no run wide enough to leave again outside off stump
Watson to Pietersen, no run full again, a good two feet outside off, ignored completely
Harris to Cook, no run well left outside off, it was a reasonably tight off stump line but sliding away from Cook shouldering arms
Harris to Cook, no run full on the off stump, blocked coming forward
Harris to Cook, no run wide enough to leave again outside off
Harris to Cook, FOUR runs full and wide of off, Cook right forward to this and punishes the bad ball well past point
Harris to Cook, no run sliding across Cook to leave again
Harris to Cook, no run down the leg side, Haddin fumbles it but Pietersen declines the bye
Watson to Pietersen, no run good length towards off stump, Pietersen forward and blocking
Watson to Pietersen, 1 run forward to a ball full enough to manouvre in front of point for a sharp single
Watson to Cook, no run good length leaving Cook all the time, he shoulders arms
Watson to Cook, FOUR runs full length on off stump, Cook forward and nudging it down, it takes a thick outside edge through gully
Watson to Cook, no run full and driveable but mistimed to mid-off
Watson to Cook, no run full towards leg stump, Cook forward and clips it to square leg
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full and wide of off stump, Pietersen leaves alone
Johnson to Pietersen, no run tighter line and Pietersen rolls it into the covers
Johnson to Pietersen, no run flashed at outside off, takes a thick outside edge and it lands short of gully, fortunate for Pietersen because that was loose, lack of foot movement on the stroke
Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs nails this one, half-volley just outside off and Pietersen times the pants off it past mid-off, much better delivery for the stroke and he executed it well
Johnson to Pietersen, no run full again, not quite up there to drive so it's just blocked with a careful forward press
Johnson to Pietersen, 1 bye good bumper, Pietersen gets out of the way, Haddin leaps up but only parries it and they take a bye
Watson to Pietersen, 1 run full at the pads, flicked at and gets a single behind square that Haddin fields off
Watson to Cook, no run full towards off stump, blocked coming forward up on the off side
Watson to Cook, no run wider line and left
Watson to Cook, no run full length just outside off, firm drive and mid-off does very well to save what would have been four, well done Harris
Watson to Cook, 3 runs strays onto the pads and Cook able to find the gap at midwicket for a well-run three, first time for a while Cook has negotiated that gap at midwicket
Watson to Pietersen, no run back on a length on off stump, Cook out to block
Johnson to Cook, no run wide of Cook's off stump and left alone
Johnson to Cook, FOUR runs strays leg side now and Cook tickles it fine of long leg
Johnson to Cook, no run slingy wide one outside off, ignored
Johnson to Cook, no run full and Cook comes out to play this, knocking it towards point
Johnson to Cook, no run short ball and Cook gets up in front of the stumps to knock it down, well played
Johnson to Cook, 1 run back of a length, 92mph, but just strays leg side again and Cook is able to fend it down to long leg
Lyon to Cook, no run forward on off stump, blocking in front of short leg, one of three around the bat
Lyon to Cook, FOUR runs slightly short and Cook back cuts nicely, Warner sprints after it like a little yappie dog and his dive into the fence is in vain
Lyon to Cook, no run floated up and Cook blocks on the front foot
Lyon to Bell, no run around the wicket, stays in the crease and dabs it in front of short leg
Lyon to Bell, no run forward this time playing in front of short leg again

Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs played from the crease and gets a thick outside edge to a ball sliding across him, luckily for Pietersen it flies between slip and gully - not sure if it was catchable - and Pietersen now has 8,000 Test runs
Johnson to Pietersen, no run short down the leg side, ignored
Johnson to Pietersen, no run another bumper, Pietersen under it easily and Haddin takes it with a right-hand leap again
Johnson to Pietersen, FOUR runs full but on the pads and clipped down fine of long leg
Johnson to Pietersen, 2 runs back of a length and pulled, gets it high on the bat, enough willow to take it beyond and wide of mid-on, relatively safe but not in total control
Johnson to Pietersen, no run another bumper, leg side and rather a waste of energy
Lyon to Bell, no run tossed up on middle and leg from round the wicket, Bell leans out to defend
Lyon to Bell, no run little bit of extra bounce, outside leg stump, Bell prods it down into the ground towards short leg
Lyon to Bell, no run floated up, again played safely down to the leg-side catcher
Lyon to Bell, no run Comes forward on leg stump to work the ball into the midwicket region
Lyon to Bell, no run full and drifting across towards off stump, Bell comes forward and drives gently to mid-off
Lyon to Bell, no run flighted, Bell gets in line and smothers the ball
Siddle to Pietersen, no run length ball, slightly wide and Pietersen drives hard, away from the front foot, gets an inside edge that could have gone anywhere
Siddle to Pietersen, no run comes forward and plays with a straight bat into the covers
Siddle to Pietersen, no run fullish, played on the front foot towards mid-off
Siddle to Pietersen, no run in the channel, KP gets forward and defends

Siddle to Pietersen, OUT slightly short, Pietersen goes after Siddle - but he can't quite clear mid-on, where Johnson takes a brilliant leaping catch! Massive wicket for Australia and Siddle knows it, the veins in his temples pulsing, letting out a primal roar as the WACA goes bananas. Pietersen sticks his bat under his arm and heads off, it's the way he plays but he'll know that shot wasn't really what England needed. Superb snag by Mitchell Johnson, though
Siddle to Stokes, no run good ball to start with, short and rising outside off, Stokes does well to drop his hands
Lyon to Bell, no run full and on middle and off, Bell gets a slight leading edge down the track
Lyon to Bell, no run on the stumps, comes forward and works the ball to mid-on
Lyon to Bell, no run drifting across, played back to the bowler
Lyon to Bell, no run tossed up nice and high, Bell watches it under his nose and then unfurls a crisp cover drive, brilliantly stopped by the diving Watson
Lyon to Bell, no run leg-stump line, straightening a touch and defended to leg
Lyon to Bell, 1 run length ball outside leg stump, tapped round the corner behind square to get off the mark
Siddle to Bell, no run good length and rising in the corridor outside off, Bell thinks about playing but drops his hands in time
Siddle to Bell, no run Bell goes back and across outside off stump to defend
Siddle to Bell, no run Siddle maintains that line in the channel, wide enough for Bell to leave this time
Siddle to Bell, no run angled in towards the top of off stump, shows it a straight bat in defence
Siddle to Bell, no run gets across and lets another one through to the keeper
Siddle to Bell, no run length delivery, comes back a fair way from outside off, Bell shoulders arms
Lyon to Stokes, no run spin for Lyon, tossed up and dipping, luring Stokes out before gripping past the outside edge. Shooper shtuff
Lyon to Stokes, 4 byes almost a full toss this, down the leg side and it beats Haddin to run away for byes
Lyon to Stokes, no run tossed up outside off and no stroke offered
Lyon to Stokes, FOUR runs Lyon drops a little short and Stokes is quick to seize on it, the forearms swinging through a powerful cut in front of square to get going with a boundary
Lyon to Stokes, no run floated up a little wide, gets on the front foot and then tucks his bat away
Lyon to Stokes, no run gets in line to defend back down the wicket
Siddle to Bell, no run length ball in the corridor, defended on the walk
Siddle to Bell, no run good discipline from Siddle, the ball isn't doing much but he's offering nothing, Bell leaves
Siddle to Bell, no run continues to patiently probe outside off, again Bell allows it through
Siddle to Bell, no run angled in from slightly wider on the crease, punched on the half-volley to mid-on
Siddle to Bell, no run hops back and across to shoulder arms
Siddle to Bell, no run line and length outside off, Bell continues to abstain from anything so vulgar as shotmaking - ah, here come the refreshments
Lyon to Stokes, no run lets a full ball bounce through to the keeper outside off
Lyon to Stokes, no run tighter line, tossed up and defended coming forwards
Lyon to Stokes, no run more signs of spin for Lyon, the ball leaving Stokes as he plants the front foot and shoulders arms
Lyon to Stokes, no run full and slightly wide, lets another one through
Lyon to Stokes, no run this one goes on with the arm and Brad Haddin lets out a groan as the ball hits his sweet spot (that is, his gloves)
Lyon to Stokes, no run floated up wide of the stumps and Stokes continues to make like a tree and leave
Siddle to Bell, 1 bye back of a length, Bell lets it go through outside off and a mix up in the cordon gives away a sloppy bye
Siddle to Stokes, 1 run continues over the wicket to the left-hander, who tucks one off his pads through backward square
Siddle to Bell, no run bangs this in hard, the ball loops through down the leg side as Bell ducks
Siddle to Bell, no run this is a brute of a bouncer from Siddle, gets big on Bell really quickly and he has to fend the ball away, via bat handle and gloves, from in front of his face
Siddle to Bell, 1 run short again, this time hooked through square leg, bouncing short of the man in the deep
Siddle to Stokes, no run touch short of a length, Stokes stands tall to defend
Lyon to Bell, 2 leg byes extra bounce for Lyon, outside leg stump, Bell looks to glance it off his hip and it deflects via the thigh pad behind square
Lyon to Bell, no run on leg stump, played back down the track
Lyon to Bell, no run tossed up, presses forward to defend
Lyon to Bell, no run full and drifting towards the off stump, Bell reaches out to drive crisply but again cut off by Watson at extra cover
Lyon to Bell, no run goes back to a length ball this time to defend in front of the stumps
Lyon to Bell, no run this seems to hurry on as Bell again drops back, chopping the ball late into the off side in front of square
Harris to Stokes, no run good length, around the line of off, Stokes defends solidly
Harris to Stokes, no run straighter and there's a bit of extra bounce, jabbed somewhat awkwardly towards midwicket
Harris to Stokes, no run fired across in the channel outside off stump and left alone
Harris to Stokes, no run slightly full, gets on the front foot and defends back to the bowler
Harris to Stokes, no run length delivery, Stokes brings the bat down at an angle and gets a leading edge into the off side
Harris to Stokes, no run low full toss from Harris but Stokes can't get it away, chopping to midwicket - maiden for Harris
Lyon to Bell, no run tossed up around leg stump, tapped down into the ground
Lyon to Bell, 1 run on the stumps, Bell works one in front of square on the leg side
Lyon to Stokes, no run tossed up and drifting to the leg side as Stokes skips down the track, plays across the line and gets a leading edge towards cover
Lyon to Stokes, no run lets this on go outside off
Lyon to Stokes, no run floated up on the stumps, plays defensively from back in the crease
Lyon to Stokes, no run full and flighted wide of the stumps and spinning further away as Stokes shoulders arms
Harris to Bell, no run good length, defended with a straight bat around off stump
Harris to Bell, no run Harris goes a little fuller, Bell plays a check-drive along the ground towards mid-off
Harris to Bell, no run drops short, heading down the leg side and ignored by the batsman
Harris to Bell, 1 run a little straight from Harris, clipped into the midwicket area, just a single as the sweeper comes in
Harris to Stokes, no run touch full of a length, stoutly blocked into the off side by Stokes
Harris to Stokes, no run pushed across the bows, left alone
Lyon to Bell, 4 byes Lyon continues to wheel away, down the leg side and this trampolines past both Bell and Haddin, running away for byes
Lyon to Bell, no run on the stumps, Bell looks to come forward but ends up blocking from the crease
Lyon to Bell, 1 run little forward press and then drops back, dabs a single in front of square
Lyon to Stokes, no run pushes this one through, left alone
Lyon to Stokes, no run tossed up and defended coming forwards

Lyon to Stokes, no run nervy moment for Stokes, as he dances down the track and then thrusts his pad at the ball, not sure if there was any bat involved but it flew past silly point at a rate of knots
Harris to Bell, no run fullish length around the line of off, Bell blocks
Harris to Bell, no run gets across and drops the bat on a full-length ball tailing in towards off
Harris to Bell, no run lets this one go through to the keeper
Harris to Bell, FOUR runs short from Harris, this time Bell has a dabble, not in control of a top-edged pull but it goes fine and nowhere near a catcher to pick up four
Harris to Bell, no run full and straight and pushed back to the bowler
Harris to Bell, no run bit of width and Bell steers a delicate back cut towards gully where David Warner makes a smart diving stop
Lyon to Stokes, no run tossed up around off stump, gets in line to defend
Lyon to Stokes, no run drops a little short, Stokes gives himself room and slashes in front of square, can't get it through
Lyon to Stokes, FOUR runs aggression from Stokes, hitting Lyon over the top of mid-off, the bowler is interested but it was a good enough connection to clear the man
Lyon to Stokes, no run chops into the off side playing back
Lyon to Stokes, FOUR runs four more for Stokes and this time a really classy shot, using his feet and driving inside to out past mid-off, it races away. He's got moxy, this lad
Lyon to Stokes, no run floated up wide of the stumps, turning away, shoulders arms
Johnson to Bell, no run good length, in the channel outside off, stays back and raises his bat out of the way
Johnson to Bell, no run fuller length and dug out towards point from in front of the off stump
Johnson to Bell, no run Johnson still managing to hit 90mph/145kph, the ball rising extravagantly outside off, Bell's not playing at that
Johnson to Bell, no run goes back and blocks in front of the stumps
Johnson to Bell, no run pushed across the right-hander from over the wicket, again Bell is happy to leave
Johnson to Bell, no run short and rearing at the throat, Bell sways back and wears it on the sternum, then meets Johnson's stare
Watson to Stokes, 1 run down the leg side, Stokes glances a length ball fine for a single
Watson to Bell, no run back of a length, nibbling away off the surface, Bell draws his bat inside the line
Watson to Bell, no run pitched up around the line of off, Bell gets in line to defend
Watson to Bell, no run blocks a length ball into the off side
Watson to Bell, no run good length, around the off, Bell taps it gently down on to the hard, cracked mud
Watson to Bell, no run Watson bangs this in very short, way over the heading of wee Belly, who smiles and goes for a fist bump with his partner
Johnson to Stokes, no run dug in, wide and rising, Stokes nods at it on the way through
Johnson to Stokes, no run back of a length, over the top of off stump, Stokes gets in line and drops it safely down
Johnson to Stokes, no run a beauty from Johnson, on a length and shaping past the outside edge, must have passed a inch or two over the top of off!
Johnson to Stokes, no run similar length delivery, this doesn't swing and Stokes blocks it with a straight bat
Johnson to Stokes, no run ripping stuff, 92mph and climbing off a length, again well played
Johnson to Stokes, no run pitched up, looking for that toe-bothering, off-stump juddering length that no batsman enjoys, Stokes punches it on the full to mid-off and makes it to stumps
Harris to Bell, no run fullish, a little floaty and wide of the stumps, leaves Bell a touch and he shoulders arms
Harris to Bell, no run pitched up, straighter line and defended in front of the off stump
Harris to Bell, no run Bell again comes forward and defends with a straight bat around the line of off
Harris to Bell, 2 runs full and slightly wide, pushes with an open face and squirts a couple through backward point, first runs of the morning
Harris to Bell, no run Harris goes up a gear, hitting 88mph and shaping the ball away from Bell, who is seduced into a airy drive - play and a miss
Harris to Bell, FOUR runs drifts on to the pads this time and there's a scrape of bat on to pad and it runs fine for a boundary
Johnson to Stokes, no run banged in, back of a length around off stump, Stokes stands up to it in defence
Johnson to Stokes, 2 runs short, something of a half-tracker and swatted through the vacant midwicket region for a couple
Johnson to Stokes, no run gets forward and lets a length ball through outside off
Johnson to Stokes, no run the arm comes through quite low, slinging the ball through well outside off, left alone
Johnson to Stokes, 2 runs pitched up in the channel and Stokes gets on the front foot, pushes into a gap at cover, more runs for England
Johnson to Stokes, no run wider, quickening up now, almost 90mph/145kph, Stokes is happy to leave
Harris to Bell, no run comes forward on the front foot and shoulders arms
Harris to Bell, no run pitched up and curving away from Bell in the corridor, another leave
Harris to Bell, OUT the in-ducker this time, Bell is hit on the front pad but Erasmus shakes his head... Might have been outside the line? Height could also come into it
Harris to Prior, no run length ball outside off, left alone
Harris to Prior, no run goes across and prods a fullish ball square on the off side
Harris to Prior, 1 run gets across outside off stump, pitched up from Harris and Prior gets going with a push to cover-point
Johnson to Prior, FOUR runs angled across on a length and Prior throws the hands through a meaty chop in front of square, that races away
Johnson to Prior, no run fired down in the channel outside off, leaves this one
Johnson to Prior, no run Johnson's not regularly in the 90s (mph, not decade) yet but a spicy bouncer still zips through to general excitement as Prior sways underneath
Johnson to Prior, no run short again, well played from back in the crease, riding the bounce to drop into the off side
Johnson to Prior, no run goes for the yorker this time, trying to sneak it through as Prior sits back, manages to drop the bat in time
Johnson to Prior, no run Jiminy Cricket, that was close! On a length, just leaving Prior and doing everything but kiss the outside edge on its way through
Harris to Stokes, no run angled across from over the wicket, Stokes plays defensively into the off side
Harris to Stokes, no run opens the face and guides the ball on the bounce to gully
Harris to Stokes, no run touch short, over middle and off, blocked into the leg side
Harris to Stokes, no run pitched up wide of the stumps, heading towards the slips, Stokes ignores it
Harris to Stokes, no run beaten, just enough seam movement to take the ball past Stokes' outside edge as he aims a booming drive down the ground
Harris to Stokes, no run full of a length and this time Stokes gets in line, punching into the ground, Harris fields in his follow through
Johnson to Prior, no run yikes, that's going to smart, a back-of-a-length ball zanging back at Prior to crash into his protective thigh padding
Johnson to Prior, 2 runs goes a but fuller, on the stumps and worked through midwicket for a couple
Johnson to Prior, no run Prior drops back and chops towards point

Johnson to Prior, 1 bye short and aiming at the cracks mid-pitch, bullseye for Johnson, though the results are unpredictable and Haddin has to leap to his right to get a glove on the ball as it shoots away from the batsman, manages to keep them to a single bye
Johnson to Stokes, no run dug in very short, climbing high over Stokes
Harris to Prior, no run good length on the stumps, Prior drops back to defend
Harris to Prior, no run shortish and played into the off side
Harris to Prior, no run comes forward, hit above the knee roll as Harris extracts extra bounce off a length
Harris to Prior, 1 run in the channel outside off, pushed into a gap in the covers and they trot a single
Harris to Bresnan, no run quick and zipping through outside off stump, Bresnan drops his hands out of harm's way
Harris to Bresnan, 3 runs goes a bit straighter, whipped with a firm bottom hand through midwicket - that's the 200 up for England, which is as much as they've had to celebrate recently
Johnson to Bresnan, no run dug in short, Bresnan drops back and blocks in front of his body
Johnson to Bresnan, 1 run another bumper, doesn't get up all that much and Bresnan taps it into the covers, no one fielding in front of square on the off side and he gets a single
Johnson to Prior, no run full and driven to mid-on, the bat turning slightly in the hands
Johnson to Prior, no run lovely ball from Johnson, drawing Prior into an uncertain poke outside off, past the outside edge
Johnson to Prior, no run Prior drops his bat out of the way as a bouncer flies through outside off
Johnson to Prior, 4 leg byes down the leg side, Prior misses with a glance but it flicks some padding and runs fine to the rope
Watson to Bresnan, no run gentle pace and noticeable away swing for Watson, Bresnan lets it go outside off
Watson to Bresnan, no run pitched up in the channel and again curling away from the batsman, who offers no stroke
Watson to Bresnan, no run gets on the front foot and leaves
Watson to Bresnan, no run Watson's arm comes through a tad low and bungs this very wide of the stumps
Watson to Bresnan, no run goes a bit straighter, forcing Bresnan to play, he prods into the covers
Watson to Bresnan, no run full and swinging away outside off, nothing doing from Bresnan - the Watson maiden machine has chugged back to life
Siddle to Prior, no run beats Prior's push first ball, Siddle immediately finds a testing line outside off
Siddle to Prior, no run line and length outside off, again Prior has a dabble and misses
Siddle to Broad, no run short ball to start with, flies through as Broad crouches out of the way
Siddle to Broad, no run short and again left alone
Siddle to Broad, 1 run Siddle digs this in, rising towards the ribcage and Broad drops it neatly in front of square to get off the mark
Watson to Broad, no run beaten trying to drive down the ground, played inside the line as it shaped back... More good stuff from Watson
Watson to Broad, no run a bouncer to follow up, keeping Broad back in the crease, he jerks out the way
Watson to Broad, no run on the stumps, played back to the bowler with a straight bat
Watson to Broad, no run short again, quick enough to have Broad ducking evasively
Watson to Broad, no run this time he sees the bumper coming and just nods it through to the keeper
Watson to Broad, FOUR runs nicely played, a punch from the crease as Watson reverts to a good length, driven on the up through the covers
Siddle to Bresnan, no run hits the deck hard, halfway down the pitch, the ball sails past the ducking Bresnan down the leg side
Siddle to Bresnan, no run good length around off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Siddle to Bresnan, FOUR runs short and a touch wide, there's room for Bresnan to free those bricklayer's arms and flay a powerful cut in front of point for four
Siddle to Bresnan, no run another bumper, heading over the top of middle and leg, Bresnan folds himself in half
Siddle to Bresnan, no run length delivery in the channel outside off, left alone
Siddle to Bresnan, 1 run short of a length and rising at the body, there's a short leg in place and Bresnan does well to jab the ball down behind square for a single
Watson to Bresnan, FOUR runs pitched up and in the slot for Bresnan to tallywhack a cover drive past mid-off for a creamy four
Watson to Bresnan, no run fullish and on off stump, pushed defensively back down the track
Watson to Bresnan, FOUR runs overpitched outside off again, this new ball isn't swinging as much for Watson and Bresnan crashes another four through extra cover
Watson to Bresnan, FOUR runs even better, four more! Full and beginning to shape but still under Bresnan's nose when he bullies another cover drive to the fence
Watson to Bresnan, no run continues to pitch the ball up, punched into the ground back to the bowler
Watson to Bresnan, no run comes forward and pushes into the off side
Johnson to Broad, no run back of a length and well kept out in front of the stumps
Johnson to Broad, no run this zips through in the corridor, rising sharply and past the outside edge as Broad fends at it inadvisedly
Johnson to Broad, no run slightly short, gets in line and blocks into the off side
Johnson to Swann, no run back of a length and down the leg side, Swann plays at it and gets hit on the thigh pad
Johnson to Swann, no run dug in short, Swann lets it through
Harris to Bresnan, no run fullish length ball, heading towards leg stump, pushed to the on side
Harris to Bresnan, no run slightly back of a length, gets in line to defend
Harris to Bresnan, no run on a length outside off and tempting Bresnan to drive, he misses by a distance as the ball seams away
Harris to Bresnan, no run on the stumps, defended with a straight bat
Harris to Bresnan, no run angling back this time, over the top of middle and off and Bresnan leaves on length, just managing to get his gloves out of the way
Harris to Bresnan, no run comes forward on the front foot and pushes towards mid-off
Johnson to Swann, no run Johnson is playing chin music with a heavy bass, Swann curls up into a little ball and starts weeping
Johnson to Swann, no run slanted across on a length outside off this time, Swann has a big woolly woof and misses completely
Johnson to Swann, no run length delivery, defended on the front foot back to the bowler
Johnson to Swann, no run goes round the wicket, coming in with the arm and blocked into the off side from the crease
Johnson to Swann, no run short, lickety split at 91mph, Swann backs away and tries to hit the cover off it, once again fails to connect
Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs Johnson now goes full, Swann's equal to it and drives four through the covers, not much cover out there
Harris to Anderson, no run on the stumps, gets in line to defend
Harris to Anderson, no run short of a length, brushes the padding and deflects leg side, Haddin collects
Harris to Anderson, no run fast and bouncy in the channel, the ball searing past the outside edge at 87mph as Anderson hangs back
Harris to Anderson, no run ouch! Anderson is hit on the arm guard, trying to fend a short ball away
Harris to Anderson, no run zoinks, that was far too good, Anderson playing down the wrong line and beaten again
Johnson to Swann, no run leg-side bumper, nowhere near Swann and Haddin has to be on his toes to grab it
Johnson to Swann, no run back of a length and at the batsman this time, Swann awkwardly gets out of the way
Johnson to Swann, no run another bumper, sailing over Swann, who's in his bunker
Johnson to Swann, no run back of a length and down the leg side again
Johnson to Swann, no run now Johnson pitches the ball up, outside leg stump though and Swann gets an inside edge on to his pad, falling well short of the leg-side catchers
Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs full again, wide of the stumps and thrashed away through backward point, another freebie four for Swann

Harris to Anderson, no run Harris thinks he's wrapped things up, Anderson playing inside one and Haddin taking the catch. There was a noise, though only the bowler was convinced - still, worth a review. It was ball flipping the back pad, however, hitting Anderson outside the line of off, so not out on both counts
Harris to Anderson, 1 run gets across and defends into the off side, they chance a single and make it
Harris to Swann, no run good length, coming back in towards off stump, Swann leans on a forward defensive
Harris to Swann, no run short of a length, drops the bat out of the way this time
Harris to Swann, FOUR runs sweetly struck, pitched up outside off and Swann hits through the line, along the ground through mid-off
Harris to Swann, (no ball) FOUR runs Swann backs away, the ball slips out of Harris' hand and a full toss is hacked through point for another boundary
Harris to Swann, 1 run goes round the wicket, short at slashed through backward point, thickish outside edge but covered by third man
Siddle to Swann, 1 run half-tracker, jumps a little more than Swann expected and he fends it behind square on the leg side

Siddle to Anderson, 1 run back of a length, at the body, Anderson nudges it down to fine leg for a single that brings up the 250 for England - worth a burst of Jingle Bells from the Barmy Army trumpeter
Siddle to Swann, no run more short stuff, steepling over the crouching Swann
Siddle to Swann, no run another well-directed bouncer but Swann isn't interested at getting involved with those
Siddle to Swann, 1 run length ball, bounces quite high and clips the inside edge as Swann plays back, rolls short on the leg side via the pad and they pick up a single
Innings Start

Andrew: "Really, this is the best batting I have seen from England in this series. They have looked really fragile when they have just been defending. KP, Bell, and Stokes look much better when they are scoring runs. If only they could do this in their first innings."
